definition: generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: My heart is not pain, but pain has long been numb.
sentences.chinese: 我的心一點也不痛，而是早已痛的麻木了。

sentences.english: And most brain-numbing of all, you have expectations about what other people expect of you.
sentences.chinese: 當腦子都麻木了，想想別人對你的預期。
悲傷使她變得遲鈍麻木了。

sentences.english: His senses dulled as the drug swept through his body.
sentences.chinese: 當毒素傳遍他全身時，他的感覺變得麻木了。

sentences.english: Does sniffing too many scents desensitize your nose?
sentences.chinese: 聞太多的香味你的鼻子會麻木？

sentences.english: I am afraid My Lover should also numb.
At the beginning they met with much stupidity and apathy.
sentences.chinese: 開始的幾次會議他們遭遇了很多麻木和冷漠。

sentences.english: Looking to flee the you, that person back, just from his back to reality.
sentences.chinese: 看着遠走的你，那伊人的背影，才從麻木中回到現實。

sentences.english: Hurstwood seemed more apathetic than ever.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎比以前更顯得麻木不仁。

sentences.english: We were like the geese, blind, lost, perishing.
sentences.chinese: 我們就像大雁一樣，盲目，迷失，麻木。
是的，監獄讓你麻木不仁。

sentences.english: Next, the researchers stimulated both the affected and unaffected limb at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 下一步，研究人員同時刺激麻木與不麻木的肢體。

sentences.english: Next, the researchers stimulated both the affected and unaffected limb at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 下一步，研究人員同時刺激麻木與不麻木的肢體。

sentences.english: Katinka froze, her limbs stiffened, and she fell motionless.
sentences.chinese: 卡廷卡凍僵了，她的四肢都麻木了，渾身失去了直覺。

sentences.english: My hands have numbed after 2 hours' biking.
sentences.chinese: 騎了兩個小時的自行車後，我的雙手都麻木了。

sentences.english: Grief and terror had so stupefied their sense, that they did not know Prospero.
sentences.chinese: 他們傷心害怕得都麻木了，竟認不出普洛斯彼羅來了。

definition: slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
